question.title: First name
Last name
Your email address
What is/are your preferred role(s) in this project?
If you wish to provide any other comments regarding your interest in one or more of these roles, please do so here.
If you plan to work as part of an analyst team, please provide the names and email addresses of the others on your team. *All members of a team should complete the intake survey.*
If you plan to work as part of an analyst team, please provide the TEAM NAME for your team (if you have one yet).
TBD: questions about expected results (depends on formulation of research question)
What is your current position?
Please choose the option that best describes your level of statistical expertise within the areas of statistics you use most frequently.

item.text: Novice. Learning to apply method(s) and to interpret output.
Moderately proficient. Able to apply method(s) to familiar data sets and questions and to interpret output. Understand important limitations of method(s).
Highly proficient. Able to apply method(s) to diverse data sets and questions and to interpret output. Understand limitations of method and articulate relevant statistical assumptions.
Expert. Understand statistical theory and details of computation for the method(s) in question. Able to teach upper level statistical course (in relevant area of statistics).

question.title: Please indicate which software you use regularly to conduct statistical analyses.
What types of statistical analyses do you commonly use?
question.explanation: Give the names of the type of models you commonly use, for example "multilevel linear regression", "random forests", "hierarchical clustering analysis", "functional principal component analysis", etc...

question.title: What transformation (if any) were applied to the variables?
question.explanation: Please, be as specific as possible by indicating for each variable that has been transformed the name of the variable as found in the dataset and the formula/operation that has been applied to it.

question.title: Where any observations excluded? If so, which criteria did you follow for the exclusion?
Which software did you use for the processing of the recordings and extraction of acoustic measurements?
question.explanation: Please indicate all pieces of software that where used for processing the recordings/extracting acoustic measures, and specify what was accomplished with each. For example: "Filtering of the recordings was done using the Matlab signal processing toolbox, while the extraction of acoustic measurements (f0, duration, formants, CoG) was accomplished with Praat."

question.title: Which software did you use for the analytical/statistical analyses?
question.explanation: Please indicate all pieces of software that where used for the analytical/statistical analyses, and specify what was accomplished with each.

question.title: Which analytical/statistical technique(s) did you employ to answer the research question?
question.explanation: Please, indicate the name of the techniques and describe specific details if necessary. For example, "We run Bayesian mixed-effects models using a Gaussian likelihood as the distribution of the outcome variable". Details about variables and parameters will be asked in later questions.

question.title: To answer the research question, which variable(s) did you choose as the outcome variable(s) (dependent or latent variable), and what was the rationale behind the choice?
question.explanation: If the analysis included multiple outcome variables, specify all of them and the rationale behind choosing each.

question.title: To answer the research question, which variable(s) did you choose as the independent variable(s) (predictors), and what was the rationale behind the choice?
question.explanation: If the analysis included multiple independent variables, specify all of them and the rationale behind choosing each.

question.title: How did you operationalised your outcome and dependent variables?
question.explanation: For example, if you choose f0 as a variable, specify from which speech domain it was extracted (for example: the phrase, the word, the syllable, the vowel, etc.), whether you extracted a summary statistic over a larger domain or a concrete value at a specific or relative point in time. For categorical variables (like age, gender, etc.), specify the levels/categories, how they are operationalised and the rationale behind the categorisation.

question.title: What unit is your effect size in?
What is the size of the effect for the research question?
question.explanation: Please, specify the magnitude and direction of the effect size, along with the 95% confidence (or credible) interval in the following format: estimate [low interval, high interval].

question.title: What other steps/analyses did you run that are worth mentioning?
question.explanation: Include effect sizes in a similar format as above if necessary.

question.title: What criteria did you use to decide on an answer to the research question?
question.explanation: For example, the decision could have been based on p-values for particular predictors and/or interactions, on Bayesian posterior distributions, or confidence/credible intervals, etc...

question.title: Often we do not anticipate possible road blocks during our analyses. Did you encounter scenarios in which you had to revise an earlier analytical decision at a later stage, e.g. change a measurement after you have statistically analyzed (parts of) the data? If so, please briefly describe the situation.
